new responseReceived.emittedExtraInfo flag indicates whether or not<span class="line"><!---->The new responseReceived.emittedExtraInfo flag indicates whether or not<!----></span><br>requestWillBeSentExtraInfo and responseReceivedExtraInfo events were<span class="line"><!---->requestWillBeSentExtraInfo and responseReceivedExtraInfo events were<!----></span><br>also emitted for the same network request.<span class="line"><!---->also emitted for the same network request.<!----></span><br><br>With this knowledge, CDP clients like puppeteer can know whether or not<span class="line"><!---->With this knowledge, CDP clients like puppeteer can know whether or not<!----></span><br>to wait for the pairing of responseReceived and ExtraInfo events.<span class="line"><!---->to wait for the pairing of responseReceived and ExtraInfo events.<!----></span><br>Without this knowledge, they currently can't expose the information in<span class="line"><!---->Without this knowledge, they currently can't expose the information in<!----></span><br>ExtraInfo events because they would get hung up waiting for ExtraInfo<span class="line"><!---->ExtraInfo events because they would get hung up waiting for ExtraInfo<!----></span><br>events for requests which don't emit them.<span class="line"><!---->events for requests which don't emit them.<!----></span><br>The information in ExtraInfo events is very important because they have<span class="line"><!---->The information in ExtraInfo events is very important because they have<!----></span><br>significantly more accurate HTTP headers, among other things.<span class="line"><!---->significantly more accurate HTTP headers, among other things.<!----></span><br><br>This also addresses a regression for puppeteer when I removed<span class="line"><!---->This also addresses a regression for puppeteer when I removed<!----></span><br>report_raw_headers from ResourceRequest in <span class="line"><!---->report_raw_headers from ResourceRequest in <!----></span>http://crrev.com/908142<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="http://crrev.com/908142"><!---->http://crrev.com/908142<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br>Puppeteer relies on report_raw_headers because it can't lazily wait for<span class="line"><!---->Puppeteer relies on report_raw_headers because it can't lazily wait for<!----></span><br>ExtraInfo events like the DevTools frontend does. However, with this new<span class="line"><!---->ExtraInfo events like the DevTools frontend does. However, with this new<!----></span><br>flag, Puppeteer can actually start using ExtraInfo events.<span class="line"><!---->flag, Puppeteer can actually start using ExtraInfo events.<!----></span><br><br>In order to implement the flag, I am plumbing it through the network<span class="line"><!---->In order to implement the flag, I am plumbing it through the network<!----></span><br>service interface. Alternatively, we could try to guess whether network<span class="line"><!---->service interface. Alternatively, we could try to guess whether network<!----></span><br>service will emit ExtraInfo events, but based on my prototyping I<span class="line"><!---->service will emit ExtraInfo events, but based on my prototyping I<!----></span><br>couldn't get this to work with the limited information we have in the<span class="line"><!---->couldn't get this to work with the limited information we have in the<!----></span><br>renderer process.<span class="line"><!---->renderer process.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1199865<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        </span>

          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

      </label>

            </tr>

        </tbody></table>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-related-issues id="reorder-related-issues"></mr-related-issues>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
